name: DevaRaja Villa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night and having read other reviews of the hotel I would urge others to read prior to booking. The room itself was fine. Not perfectly clean; there were some hefty dusty cobwebs for example but the bed linen and bathroom appeared very clean and that is what matters. There was no TV but we had been pre-warned of this and we were also well warned that an extra 10% for VAT would be added to our bill.
reviews.title: Adequate rooms, not particularly welcoming

reviews.text: The room was also pretty quiet considering how close it is to the thick of the nightlife action on serendipity beach road.
reviews.title: Should have read the reviews first ,,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The complaint I would have would be regarding managements attitude. I think for someone reading this I would urge them to read the managers responses to previous reviews. Not everyone is cut out to be succesfull in hospitality and making guests feel like they are a nuisance isn't really good business. The Khmer staff were lovely, maybe the manager should hand over more responsibility to them
reviews.title: A great place to stay near the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Deva Raja has been consistently criticised by Trip Advisor reviewers, and mostly with good cause. I can’t speak for the condition of all the rooms as I only saw two, and, though basic, these were okay by the rather low S’ville standards. Also, the location is not at all bad – near enough to easily access the popular beach area, but far enough away to give a sense of calm. But the other complaints – little comparable value for money, disinterested service, insufficient attention to room cleanliness, the seemingly deliberate ploy to disguise the “tax” – are all valid. On top of these, the establishment chose to reduce their room rates during my stay – after I had indicated the intention to remain for a few days – though lacked the courtesy to offer the reduction for my remaining stay, or even to provide an explanation. One other unique feature of the Deva Raja is the “management responses” to reviewer criticism - that end up attacking the reviewers themselves!
reviews.title: Overpriced, messy and unwelcoming. Horrible. NOT boutique hotel

reviews.text: Like several others reviewers, I suggest you keep walking past Deva Raja. You will likely find something you will be happier with in S’ville.
reviews.title: DejaRaja Villa, Sihanoukville - small and cosy hotel

description: All the rooms at Deva Raja are large and sensitively furnished. Each room has air conditioning, en-suite bathrooms, cable TV, fridge and free wi-fi internet access. And every room contains original artwork by artists from southeast Asia. Hotel safe available. We have doubles, singles and family rooms, some sea view rooms with balconies and bungalows. 3 minute walk from white sands of Ochhueteal Beach.
